title: Welcome to the league of Lee sin
body: Expect the most average of plays with the outcome of having to deal with a 16/4 lee sin late game. Don't try to queue anymore, you'll see him in every game, ready to carry his team once again.

replies.body:
With a 35% pick rate that riot have officially said they aren't going to do shit about....

they don't want to change lee to make him less played because they don't want to make a champ 'less fun' but what they don't realise is that Lee having a 35% pick rate is 'Less fun' for the other 65%

He's not over powered though.

Riot will only change a champion if they completely outset other champions by being over powered.
Lee Sin is actually quite underwhelming in terms of power.

The only reason he is played so much is because of the same situation as Vayne. Doesn't matter what Riot does to these champs they'll be played over and over because of how the community sees them.
The community looks at Lee Sin and thinks they can pull off what insec does, the community looks at Vayne and thinks they can pull off what Dlift does.

That's it, that's all there is to it.

Riot can't just nerf a champion because it's seen too much, just be thankful they don't get every skin that comes out each year.

I never said he's overpowered, i said he's overplayed which is 100% true just like Vayne.
and regardless of how powerful they are, people get bored and frustrated by playing with and against the same champions over and per again.
imagine if every car you ever saw was a yellow mini, eventually you're going to be really bloody sick of yellow mini's

And I'm not saying i have a solution to this problem, but it IS a problem, and instead of ignoring it they should be looking at other methods of tackling it.

atm their current fix to the problem is and i quote: "we will update ALL the other junglers until they are as fun to play as Lee sin"
now you're a practical guy (and a jungler) does this sound like a good plan to you?
imaging all your favourite jungle champs being changed, just because they don't want to touch Lee.

There are literally billions of possible combinations for a game with different champs. The same game really is a rare one off. 

Lee sin is actually one of the most balanced champs in the game. Even the pros like Diamond Prox said he is. He isn't overpowered. Yes he is played alot. He is a fun champ. Stop bitching. Why the fuck would they nerf a champ from it being overplayed. Plz

Lee is not overpowered. He i just played alot because of how the community is. Watching gripex pulling off sick plays makes you want to play lee and try out making plays. Same goes for Vayne, Zed and Udyr. The community is basically influenced by the pros to play these champions
zed - faker
vayne - gosu/dlift
udyr - trick2g

They just want to be the pros that they watch on stream.

I can mention many many more champions but those are a few that people like to play because they are wannabes.

Being a wannabe isn't bad btw xP

The majority of my favourite jungle champs have either already been updated, or are unlikely to.

Sion, Diana, Vi, Rek'Sai, Master Yi, Leona, Malphite, Rengar.

They are all on par, or better than Lee Sin.

Again, Riot have no control over the popularity of a champion.
It is entirely the community who controls this.
This is especially so in OCE, where the majority of players watch videos from a month to years old and think that's the current state of the game.
Ever notice that the OCE META is what NA had two patches ago?
Hell I still see players trying to do Alistar with Triforce and Static Shiv from a single patch two seasons ago at Worlds.

People are stupid, and that is why Lee Sin is so popular.

Well my conversation with them led me to believe they want to change them ALL.

I agree that video's have a lot to do with the popularity of a champ and that RIOT cant control that. 
but yes people are stupid, i agree 100% with that...

I have never seen a tri-force alistar with shiv.... and i hope to god i will never have to..

2014 Worlds had a Korean player play Triforce/Shiv Ali ONCE, and ever since it's been a nightmare for me seeing it everywhere.
The week after the match I saw it in like 50% of my games, try to tell a moron it was patched out before worlds even started and they would flame and troll all game.

Same as when you tell an idiot something was changed "Oh shut up you stupid %%%%, (youtuber) said it works".

Oh god....

thankfully i haven't had that.
I dunno man - a good lee sin is very very good
If you can't beat em might as well join em, lee sin main comfirmed.

Many people find him quite fun to play due to his mechanics and what you can do with him.  Obviously people are going to pay the champs they have the most fun playing.  No point nerfing or changing that just because he is seen too much.

People play champs that are powerful, not because they are fun, thats the simple truth of it.
there are a few exceptions, and i like to think I'm one of them. But the hard truth is that most people only care about power.

Annie and Garen are possibly two of the most boring champs in the game, yet they are played WAY more often than Zyra/Syndra/Azir/Gangplank etc. etc. which are much more interesting and fun champs by anyones standards.

People see Lee making plays and see it as power so they play him.
